4073537060.title: Cloud Data Scientist (m/f/d)
4073537060.description:
About the job
Why Choose TD SYNNEX:

As a Fortune 500 global corporation, operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 23,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.

TD SYNNEX continues building up its highly successful Data Practice and looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientists to join our European excellence team.

About the role:

In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of business scenarios in technology distribution industry. As the field of advanced analytics is rapidly evolving, the Data Scientist is responsible for staying current on leading-edge business applications, tools and approaches, proactively working with the Analytics Leadership to enhance offerings that deliver competitive advantage to TD SYNNEX.

Our Data team working environment and what you'll do:

Always working with the latest Cloud based Data Science technologies, such as Snowflake SQL, Python/R, Tableau, Power BI, AWS Services...
Large number and size of the data sources / Variable analytics use cases (truly BIG DATA)
100% of work on real use cases, with real business use (no POC’s without use)
Agile and experimental approach, new implementations within days not months
Active involvement in E2E business solution, incl. solution design and presentation of the results of your work. In our company, your opinion matters, and your personal development is equally important like the development of the company.
Collaboration with Cloud Vendor Business within TD SYNNEX departments and other BI Teams across the organization.

What we're kindly looking for:

Minimum of 2 - 4 years experience working as a Data Scientist or BI Intelligence 
Fluency in English is required
Have deep Data Science expertise: The successful candidate will have a wealth of experience with applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations, such that they can efficiently and effectively advise multiple teams on the best path to uncovering critical insights for clients.
Relevant SQL skills
Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required: Hands on programming/scripting experience in Python or R. Power BI and Power platforms experience is necessary.
An autonomous self-starter with a passion for analytics and problem solving. You will help build new Analytics service offerings that grow our portfolio of products and will captures proprietary content and support the creation of proposal/selling documents.
Strong presence, strong collaborator skills and ability to operate effectively in a matrix organization are a must.
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools Have a proven ability to synthesize complex data; as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings and are able to translate this into business implications for our clients.
Confident statistical and machine learning skills
Strong experience with practical data science and hands-on involvement with deployed ML pipelines in a business environment
Team player with great communication skills and willing to help the other team members. Potentially act as mentor to juniors.
Proactive and self-motivated

What We Offer:

Hybrid work - (2 days at the office, 3 days at home)
We value continuous learning and provide you with the necessary resources to upskill your professional competencies
We provide comprehensive benefits including health insurance, paid leave, retirement plans, and quite some more.

What’s In It For You?

Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.

Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway. 

At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!
Why Choose TD SYNNEX:
Fortune 500 global corporation

4167199468.title: Senior Data Scientist - Machine Learning
4167199468.description:
About the job
We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Life Sciences and Healthcare in Barcelona. This is an amazing opportunity to work across our LS&H solutions delivering solutions that positively impact patient lives globally.

The team reports to the Head of Technology for Life Sciences and Healthcare. By working with us, you'll have the opportunity to develop cutting-edge machine learning and AI models, including Generative AI, to support delivering the LS&H goal of empowering our customers to create a healthier tomorrow.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

An advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Technology, or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Minimum 6 years of industry experience as well as 5 years of proven track record in the application of ML.
Excellent analytical and Python programming skills. Other languages a plus. 
Good communication & presentation skills: you feel comfortable connecting people, gathering data & information across business unit boundaries and telling & selling the story
Ability to test ideas and adapt methods quickly end to end from data extraction to implementation and validation

It would be great if you also had . . . 

Experience with search engines, classification algorithms, recommendation systems, and relevance evaluation methodologies
Experience with NLP solutions in the Life Sciences and Healthcare domain.
Experience with ML pipelines and deployment
A master’s degree or PhD with a focus on AI/ML

What will you be doing in this role?

Researches and identifies Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods and algorithms to solve specific problems to improve user experience on Life Sciences and Healthcare and products,
Implements these methods and devises appropriate test plans to validate and compare the different approaches
Identifies new applications of ML and NLP in the context of Clarivate’s extensive sets of content and data
Explores existing data for insights and recommends additional sources of data for improvements

Products you will be developing

We are mainly using Python for model and code development, you can use whatever IDE & tools you like best (we have people using PyCharm, Databricks, Jupyter Notebook, …), model deployment is on either AWS or Google Cloud depending on the internal customer’s preference, projects are assigned on a quarterly basis but most span multiple quarters up to a year and a half. Over the past 2 decades, we’ve covered everything from UX experiments, decision support systems, search engines, information extraction, machine learning, generative AI – you name it. So the work you’ll be doing will be quite varied and allow you to expand and apply your knowledge on all the latest developments in the AI/ML/MLP domains.

About The Team

The team consists of 12 people and is reporting to the Head of Technology for Life Sciences and Healthcare.

The Life Sciences and Healthcare Technology team supports The Clarivate Life Science and Healthcare business unit deliver outcomes to positively impact patient lives globally. We create data solutions and products that span the entire drug lifecycle through Strategy, R&D, Regulatory and Commercialization. The Data Science team provides solutions across our content acquisition, content delivery and product solutions and works to support all technology teams and our business to deliver compelling AI solutions to enhance our workflow and products.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours per week. The working schedule is flexible, primarily centered on CET time zone with occasional need to accommodate meetings with US or East Asia time zones. The position is hybrid with office visits required 2-3 times per week.

What We Can Offer You

A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.
Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Free Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation. 

,

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

4167591512.title: Data scientist - Pyspark
4167591512.description:
About the job
¡En @Ayesa crecemos juntos! 🚀 ✨
Cada profesional de nuestra empresa es importante para nosotros, nos ayudan a crecer de manera diversa y gracias a ellos somos más de 12.000 personas trabajando con el mismo objetivo en más de 40 países.
Si eres una persona entusiasta, te apasiona la #tecnología y buscas un nuevo reto profesional ¡Este es tu sitio!
Buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Data scientist para incorporase en el área de Data & IA para un proyecto de uno de nuestros clientes bancarios en nuestras oficinas de 📍Madrid en modalidad híbrida (disponibilidad en otras zonas geográficas).

¡Anímate a dar el salto!¡Te estamos esperando!

Funciones:
Te incorporarás para a un equipo multidisciplinar dentro de un proyecto de un cliente del sector banca. Las funciones a desarrollar son:
Desarrollar herramientas de software, principalmente en Python, enfocadas en el tratamiento de datos.
Resolución de incidencias: apoyo usuarios, dudas técnicas, incidencias en circuitos de integración continua, etc.
Gestión operativa: altas de usuarios, cambios de permisos, etc.
Crear y compartir documentación clara y accesible para favorecer la adopción de nuestras herramientas.
Aportar soporte en formación a otros países y equipos con diferente nivel técnico.

Requisitos imprescindibles: 
Experiencia en programación con Python y POO
Buenas prácticas de programación: documentación, test unitarios, etc.
Conocimientos de git y repositorios de código
Trabajo con sistemas de Integración continua (Jenkins o similar)
Experiencia con librerías de tratamiento de datos (pandas/pyspark) "Me interesa la forma de pensar de datos más que el conocimiento al dedillo de la sentencia"
Capacidad para comunicar y escalar el conocimiento técnico de forma sencilla y paciente.

Deseable: 
Conocimientos sobre Amazon Web Services y/o disposición para aprender.
Flexibilidad para involucrarse en tareas de gestión interna cuando sea necesario.

Te ofrecemos un camino lleno de aventuras:
🔹 ¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! Crece con nuestros programas de desarrollo! Te ayudaremos a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente participando en proyectos vanguardistas con los mejores profesionales del sector.
🔹 Porque lo importante sois tú y los tuyos : contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, Smart Job y jornada intensiva en verano.
🔹 Tú decides cómo usar tu dinero: disfruta de nuestra retribución flexible, contamos con: Seguro médico, Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte.
🔹 Plan Bienestar descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más.
🔹 Diviértete participando en los diferentes concursos y actividades que organizamos: ¿te gusta el deporte, escribir, la fotografía? Todo tiene cabida.
🔹¡Actualízate! apostamos por un aprendizaje continuo, contamos con formación especializada, certificaciones e idiomas.
🔹¡Deja tu huella! Impacta con nuestros proyectos de voluntariado social.
¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo! 💫🌎

Atendiendo a la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, Ayesa se ha marcado como objetivo promover la defensa y aplicación efectiva del principio de igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, evitando cualquier tipo de discriminación laboral por razón de sexo, garantizando así las mismas oportunidades de ingreso. Asimismo, fomentamos la diversidad, rechazando cualquier tipo de discriminación por razones de raza, sexo, diversidad funcional, religión, orientación sexual, identidad sexual, o cualquier otra condición personal o social, apostando por construir un entorno inclusivo y enriquecedor.

4176151242.title: Data Scientist
4176151242.description:
About the job
Desde Huxley nos encontramos en búsqueda de un Data Scientist para el desarrollo de productos data-based y el desarrollo de modelos de data science con Python y Pyspark. 
 Responsabilidades:
Colaborar con diferentes productos y unidades de negocio dentro del banco para desarrollar productos basados en datos y derivar conocimientos accionables.
Participar en el desarrollo de modelos de ciencia de datos utilizando Python y PySpark, y en la manipulación de datos con SQL, Python (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn) y Spark.
Utilizar herramientas de AWS para análisis de datos y manejar grandes conjuntos de datos en plataformas de Big Data.
Diseñar e implementar soluciones analíticas, que van desde análisis estadísticos básicos hasta algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático e inteligencia artificial (experiencia en deep learning es un plus).
Trabajar de manera proactiva y con mínima supervisión para alcanzar los objetivos.
 Requisitos: 
Excelentes habilidades de programación en SQL, Python y Spark, y experiencia con herramientas de AWS para análisis de datos.
Experiencia en el diseño e implementación de soluciones analíticas avanzadas y en el manejo de grandes conjuntos de datos en plataformas de Big Data.
Contacto con cliente y conocimiento práctico del sector financiero. 
Residencia y permiso de trabajo en España. 
 ¿Qué ofrecemos?
Modelo híbrido: 2 días en la oficina. 
Salario competitivo, acorde con experiencia. 
Tarjeta Restaurante 
Oficinas: Madrid 
 Si te interesa esta oportunidad, no dudes en aplicar y me pondré en contacto contigo lo antes posible.

4164123147.title: Marketing Data Scientist
4164123147.description:
About the job
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.

Primary Responsibilities

Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time-zones

Qualifications

BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years workingwith Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent inter-personal communication skills - especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

4146942950.title: Data Scientist/ Data Engineer (W2/EOR- US/CAN, Europe and LATAM)
4146942950.description:
About the job
Job Description

This is a 6-month contract with possibility of extension, 40 hours/ week. This is classified as an EOR engagement. No C2C Engagements. No visa sponsorship/ visa transfer available.

Open to candidates based in LATAM, Europe, US and/or Canada who are able to overlap PST-EST hours.

Please note: The hourly rate may vary depending on the candidate’s country of residence due to Employer of Record (EOR) fees. These fees, which cover essential services such as payroll processing, benefits administration, and compliance with local employment laws, are country-specific and can impact the final rate offered.

Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. Our mission is to bring community, belonging, and empowerment to everyone in the world. Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on content, stories, and discussions about the topics they care about the most. From pets to parenting, with over 100,000 active communities and over 70 million daily active users, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet.

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist / Data Engineer to join our team and help drive data-driven decision-making. You will be responsible for designing and maintaining data pipelines, building analytical models, and ensuring data availability for business insights. This role requires a mix of engineering expertise, machine learning knowledge, and the ability to work with large datasets.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Build, deploy, and optimize machine learning models for predictive analytics.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance across systems.
Develop and maintain data warehouse architectures and data lakes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, product managers, and software engineers.
Implement best practices for data governance, security, and compliance.
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) to manage data infrastructure.
Develop real-time data processing solutions using Kafka, Spark, or similar technologies.
Create data visualization dashboards and reports for business stakeholders.

Required Qualifications

Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python, SQL, and either Java or Scala.
Data Engineering: Experience with ETL pipelines, Apache Airflow, dbt, or similar tools.
Big Data & Databases: Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Snowflake, BigQuery).
Machine Learning (if applicable): Familiarity with scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure (e.g., S3, Redshift, BigQuery).
Data Streaming: Knowledge of Kafka, Kinesis, or similar technologies.
Data Warehousing: Understanding of star schema, OLAP, and data modeling principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

4170964952.title: Data Scientist
4170964952.description:
About the job
The AI&Automation team is responsible for coordinating all efforts implied to increase AI&Automation adoption across HP’s Commercial Organization, providing RPA/AI/ML solutions to business use cases.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, match with both traditional ML methods (forecasting algorithms, recommender systems) and Generative AI and large language models. and deploy solutions in real-world applications.

Main Responsibilities

Increase the adoption of AI/ML technology within HP’s Commercial Organization by finding applicability of technology in real business challenges, and ensuring adoption of the solutions built
Collaborates with AI& Automation Product Owner to validate backlog priorities and whether similar solutions might be in place and could be scaled/ leveraged.
Collaborates with cross-functional teams: data scientists, data/cloud engineers, fe/be/RPA developers, and domain experts to make sure the business requirements for the identified AI opportunities are properly turned into viable and sustainable AI solutions that address the specific challenges and can be adopted
Engages with business stakeholders who need AI/ML solutions to understand the requirements and recommend the proper solution for their need, connects model results to business strategy, and produces recommendations that match business situation.
Designs and implements models to discover patterns and predictions that generate business value and innovation. Develops and implements AI/ML models: from data preprocessing and feature engineering to ensure high-quality data inputs for AI models to model development and fine-tuning to address issues of overfitting or underfitting. Delivers performance evaluations and model validations to assess the effectiveness of the AI/ML models in our portfolio.
Communicates insights and recommendations: Presents findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, adapted to business understanding. Translates complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical audiences.
Coaches team members, shares knowledge, and contributes to the growth and development of the CO AI& Automation Community.
Stays updated with AI research and advancements: Keeps abreast of the latest trends, techniques, and research papers in the field of AI and machine learning. Continuously explores new algorithms and approaches to enhance the organization's AI capabilities.
Manages vendor/technologies identification and selection process when external solutions are required

Job Requirements

Bachelor's, master's or Ph.D. degree in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, or equivalent.
Typically, 4-6 years of relevant work experience.
Proficiency in Python and PySpark Programming: Strong coding skills in Python for data manipulation, model development, and integration with Azure services.
Experience with Azure Services: Knowledge of key Azure services like Azure Machine Learning, Azure AI Search, and Azure Functions for deploying RAG systems.
Expertise in Databricks: Ability to design, develop, and optimize workflows in Azure Databricks for data processing and feature engineering.
Understanding of NLP and GenAI concepts: Familiarity with Large Language Models, prompt engineering for LLMs, vector databases, and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems.
Experience in Applied Statistics and Algorithms: Use statistics, mathematics, algorithms, and programming to address business challenges.
Familiarity with the deployment and scaling RAG systems in production, using Azure’s containerization options such as Docker, AKS (Azure Kubernetes Service), or Azure Functions.
Ability to define and create complex ML models to pull valuable insights, predictions, and innovation from data.
Proven track record of delivering successful AI projects or research work.
Familiarity with popular AI frameworks, libraries, and tools.

Knowledge & Skills

Proper understanding of digital industry trends (RPA, AI, ML) and their benefits.
Advanced communication skills (i.e. written, verbal, presentation) and collaboration skills to work effectively within a multidisciplinary team.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to tackle complex AI challenges.
Proven experience working in globally distributed virtual teams
Proficiency in English is a must
Ability to effectively communicate data insights and negotiate options at senior management levels.
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure successful AI/ML implementation.
Excellent program management, problem solving, and analytical skills, and the ability to execute a program within the scope of overall strategies.
Team player

Ability to define and create complex ML models to pull valuable insights, predictions, and innovation from data.
Proven track record of delivering successful AI projects or research work.
Familiarity with popular AI frameworks, libraries, and tools.
Knowledge & Skills
Proper understanding of digital industry trends (RPA, AI, ML) and their benefits.
Advanced communication skills (i.e. written, verbal, presentation) and collaboration skills to work effectively within a multidisciplinary team.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to tackle complex AI challenges.
Proven experience working in globally distributed virtual teams
Proficiency in English is a must
Ability to effectively communicate data insights and negotiate options at senior management levels.
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure successful AI/ML implementation.
Excellent program management, problem solving, and analytical skills, and the ability to execute a program within the scope of overall strategies.

4125995624.title: Technical Data Scientist (Junior/Senior profiles)
4125995624.description:
About the job
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services and Accenture Song—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at accenture.com.

If you are ready to lead the total reinvention of the company through technology and data, you have an opportunity to join the Accenture team and change the future of our clients and society

Technical Data Science / Data Engineer role

You will have the opportunity of being part of a highly specialized team, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the team, you will be working on new data architectures, and you will have plenty of opportunities to upskill and access to training and certification processes for a wide range of technologies.

Your role


Working on data engineering tasks including data ingestion, data quality, ETL processes, to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and highly performant technologies

Working on the development of data model and efficient data architecture schemas, from the definition of data governance policies to the availability of data sets for business use case development

Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients on data processing and data management

Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations


Key Responsibilities


Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on high performance data management technologies

Design the integration with legacy data sources

Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures

Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements

Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy

Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals

Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts


Required Skills


Programming skills in Python and PySpark, eventually including R

SQL and NoSQL based technologies

Good knowledge on Big Data technologies, e.g., Spark, HDFS and Parquet

Good management with REST APIs

Experience on Public Cloud Technologies like AWS, Azure, GCP, etc., or Private Cloud Technologies like Palantir, Splunk, Cloudera, etc.

Any exposure to CI/CD (DevOps, GiT, Jira, IaaC) is a plus

Any exposure to ML, AI, DL with focus on MLOps (MLFlow, Prefect, TFX…) is a plus


At Accenture, a company recognized as a Great Place To Work®, we are committed to a hybrid work model that, thanks to technology and our facilities, allows us to maintain the essential human connection to work with our teams and clients. This connection enables us to uphold our culture of inclusion and diversity and to be, according to Refinitiv, the most diverse company in the world.

Additionally, we offer you other benefits such as:


Medical, Life, and Accident Insurance

Medical service and wellness programs

Flexible compensation program and stock purchase plan

Flexibility programs (scheduling, days off, vacations...)

Individualized training itinerary

Sustainability programs and Accenture Foundation

Employee network for diversity

Other benefits: Bankinter office with special conditions and profit sharing

4172305673.title: Data Scientist
4172305673.location: Tres Cantos, Community of Madrid, Spain
4172305673.description:
About the job
We are expanding our Big Data and Artificial Intelligenceteam to participate in projects in sectors such as banking, healthcare, space...

We like to get straight to the point, we will tell you what is not on the web. If you want to know more about us, visit GMV

WHAT CHALLENGES WILL YOU FACE?

In this team, you will be part of the quantum computing team, tackling innovative challenges every day such as:

🧠 Designing, developing, and implementing machine learning and data analysis models

🤖 Designing and developing solutions based on Artificial Intelligence.

💼 Participating in pre-sales activities and offer preparation.

🚀 Working in a team with agile methodologies.

🌍 Having the opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment.

WHAT DO WE NEED IN OUR TEAM?

For this position, we are looking for engineers with experience in

🤖 Machine Learning

🐍 Python

📊 Data extraction and processing

⚡ Agile methodologies

🧠 Generative AI

We also value previous experience and knowledge in:

🏦 Functional knowledge of the banking or insurance sector

🕵️ Experience in fraud detection

📂 Data governance

☁️ Cloudera

🔗 Kafka, Nifi

🌍 Cloud (AWS, Azure, or Google)

WHAT DO WE OFFER?

💻 Hybrid work model and 8 weeks per year of remote work outside your usual geographical area

🕑 Flexible working hours with intensive workdays on Fridays and in summer.

🚀 Development of a personalized career plan, training, and support for language learning.

🌍 National and international mobility. Are you coming from another country? We offer a relocation package.

💰 Competitive salary with continuous reviews, flexible remuneration, and discounts on brands.

💪Wellbeing program: medical, dental, and accident insurance; free fruit and coffee, training in physical, mental, and financial health, and much more!

⚠️ In our selection processes, you will always have telephone and personal contact, either in person or online, with our talent acquisition team. Also, we will never request bank transfers or bank cards. If someone contacts you through another process, please write to our team at privacy@gmv.com

❤️We promote equal opportunities in recruitment, committed to inclusion and diversity.

WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? JOIN US!

If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact Clara Sánchez Lobato, responsible for this vacancy.

4169083084.description:
About the job
En Sopra Steria trabajamos para hacer posible la transformación digital de nuestros clientes y para conseguirlo necesitamos seguir creciendo y sumando gracias a personas como tú.

Nuestros empleados coinciden en el gran equipo y ambiente que formamos en Sopra Steria. Somos más de 46.000 personas trabajando en 25 países y nuestra misión es unir talento y tecnología, tratando de ayudarte a que encuentres un lugar en el que poder desarrollar todo tu potencial.

¿Te atreves a crear el futuro? ¿Buscas un reto profesional dónde crecer profesionalmente?

Buscamos incorporar a nuestro equipo un perfil Data Engineer con experiencia en Python y Databricks

La persona seleccionada se integrará en nuestro proyecto insignia, en la Administración Pública Catalana, colaborando en el principal centro de control de infraestructuras.

No buscamos la perfección, pero nos gustaría que tuvieras...

* Se requiere un perfil técnico del dato con experiencia en databriks; trabajará junto al Arquitecto del proyecto para nutrir la PTD (plataforma transversal del dato, más info en "Responsabilidades y funciones") que se ha desarrollado de manera centralizada desde el proyecto.
* Se requiere buenas softkills porque tendrá que interactuar con director@s de las áreas 
- Catalán.

Porque sabemos lo que necesitas....Ofrecemos:

Facilidades para ti, para tu tiempo. ¡No todo va a ser trabajo!
Participa en proyectos retadores. ¿Te animas a aprender algo nuevo?
Crece con un programa de desarrollo continúo personalizado.
Disfruta de nuestros Beneficios y accede al Plan de retribución flexible.

¡Atrévete a trabajar de una forma diferente y conócenos!
https://www.soprasteria.es/

4008659320.title: Pricing Data Scientist
4008659320.description:
About the job
¿Tienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podrías asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estarás en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de quién seas o cuál sea tu función, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misión: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor diseñado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el éxito de los demás. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una dirección nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente estés pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Además de grandes compañeros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonomía y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitirá alcanzar el éxito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti 

Creemos en la conciliación y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una política que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 días al año. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

🏁 La libertad de explorar las posibilidades 

En Prima nos movemos rápido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de enseñanza y aprendizaje. Y tendrás sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

🌈 Nuestra fórmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento 

Desde seguros médicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aquí para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, así que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Nuestra misión es ser el mejor proveedor de seguros de Europa, y nuestras avanzadas capacidades analíticas aplicadas al Pricing son nuestra arma más potente para lograrlo: las decisiones sobre los precios impactan directamente al crecimiento y la sostenibilidad del negocio y garantizan la protección a nuestros clientes en situaciones adversas. Para estar siempre un paso adelante de un mercado que es también rico en datos e información tenemos que ser dinámicos, creativos y precisos. Por eso buscamos profesionales capaces y motivados para nuestro equipo de Data Scientists.

En Concreto, Te Encargarás De Estas Actividades

 Analizar cualquier tipo de fuente de datos con el objetivo de crear y mejorar la tecnología predictiva patentada por Prima, análisis como: modelos de clasificación para mejora de variables, realización de modelos de predicción Loss Cost, elasticidad precio de la demanda, probabilidad de renovación, optimización del valor de la cartera.
 Liderar la implementación de procesos y metodologías en el motor de precios, ya sean mejoras de los modelos predictivos desarrollados, o nuevas features/lógicas.
 Continuo análisis de impactos de los proyectos sobre cualquier acción o decisión tomada o pendiente de decidir.
 Liderar el traqueo del dato, monitorizando los principales KPI y posterior toma de decisiones.
 Agilizar los procedimientos internos, gracias a sistemas de selección automática de clientes, clasificación de documentos y detección de fraudes.

¿Qué estamos buscando?

 Background de negocio y analítico. Buscamos personas con una gran implicación en el negocio, que quieran formar parte no solo del aspecto técnico del rol, sino también tener una visión estratégica en el equipo, además de mostrar habilidades destacadas en el análisis de interpretación del dato. Tan importante es el “qué” como el “por qué”. Además de sentir comodidad proponiendo nuevas metodologías, buscamos proactividad en las alternativas y razonamientos estratégicos que subyacen. La responsabilidad sobre el negocio es clave.
 El Data Science de Pricing & Underwriting es cliente y proveedor al mismo tiempo. Somos responsables tanto de las metodologías utilizadas como del impacto de las mismas en el negocio.
 Tienes conocimientos y/o experiencia en programación en Python y conoces las principales librerías de análisis de datos y aprendizaje automático (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, XGBoost, etc.).
 Mentalidad crítica y curiosa. Miras el mundo que te rodea y siempre te preguntas "¿por qué?". Piensas en cómo mejorar las cosas y buscas que tus ideas se hagan realidad. Además, te rodearán otras cabezas pensantes con gran talento que te enriquecerán y a las que enriquecerás compartiendo vuestros puntos de vista.
 Tienes al menos un nivel intermedio-alto de inglés. Prima cada vez es más internacional y buscamos colaborar con otros equipos, por lo que el lenguaje común que utilizamos es el inglés.

Además de los requisitos básicos, evaluaremos con atención estas características:

 Tienes experiencia laboral previa en roles similares, con una base en estadística, programación e implementación de algoritmos.
 Puedes crear conjuntos de datos utilizando lenguajes de extracción de datos (como MySQL o Redshift).
 Puedes analizar y crear modelos en Excel.

Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambición. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusión en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminación por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religión, orientación sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, información genética, embarazo u otras características personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislación nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, únete a nosotros en el fast lane.
Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti
La libertad de explorar las posibilidades
Nuestra fórmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento
Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

4145904183.title: DATA SCIENTIST
4145904183.description:
About the job
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA SCIENTIST

¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango está formado por Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Deep Learning Researchers y Software Engineers que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la última tecnología en plataformas de Big Data y computación distribuida.

Cada Uno De Los Squads De Análisis Avanzado Tiene Como Objetivo Desarrollar y Evolucionar Algoritmos De Aprendizaje Automático Para Hacer Frente a Algunos De Los Principales Retos Técnicos y Empresariales De Mango

 Personalization Squad: Equipo al que se incorporará la persona seleccionada y que es responsable de desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes de Mango, tanto en el sitio web y la app como en las comunicaciones por email. Aprovechando el gran volumen de datos de compras y de navegación de los clientes, los algoritmos desarrollados incluyen recomendaciones de productos, segmentaciones de clientes o la generación de contenido personalizado mediante IA generativa, asegurando su despliegue en tiempo real.
 Generative Artificial Intelligence squad: Impulsar iniciativas innovadoras relacionadas con algoritmos generativos (texto, imagen, video, etc). Este squad ha liderado el desarrollo de la plataforma de IA basada en LLM para los casos de uso internos. Además, es responsable de impulsar la transformación que se está llevando a cabo en los procesos creativos empleando modelos de IA de generación de imágenes.
 Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático que determinen las promociones y descuentos óptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.
 Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detección temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cuántas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificación de la temporada.

Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.

¿CÓMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?

En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy dinámico, motivado por las nuevas tecnologías, con pasión por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a través de los datos.

¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?

Como Data Scientist formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. Trabajarás desarrollando soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial desarrolladas con modelos de datos y algoritmos de última generación. Estos productos de datos permiten casos de uso muy innovadores en el espacio del retail, como la geoanalítica, la robotización, la personalización omnicanal, la tienda conectada, la visión por ordenador, el consumidor 360º y las decisiones en tiempo real.

En tu día a día…

Realizarás el desarrollo de algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales.
Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería (por ejemplo, integración continua, automatización de pruebas, etc.) en un sólido equipo de ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos.
Utilizarás Spark para escalar tus modelos y aprovecharás las herramientas de MLOps para desplegarlos en producción.
Interactuarás con las partes interesadas del negocio para asegurar la alineación y la adopción adecuadas; y participarás en la entrega del proyecto de principio a fin.
Trabajarás con un enfoque rápido e iterativo en nuevas ideas y pruebas de conceptos.
Estarás conectado a los últimos desarrollos en Data Science y MLOps e invertirás tiempo en traer nuevas tecnologías y mejores prácticas a Mango.

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Al menos 4 años de experiencia como Data Scientist.
Grado o Máster en Ciencias de Datos, Inteligencia artificial, Informática, Matemáticas, u otros campos cuantitativos.
Al menos 4 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python, u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Experiencia desarrollando en PySpark para procesar grandes volúmenes de información de manera eficiente.
Experiencia desarrollando modelos matemáticos y algoritmos predictivos (modelos supervisados y no supervisados, clustering, redes neuronales, etc.).
Experiencia desarrollando soluciones de machine learning end-to-end, desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento.
Experiencia trabajando con servicios Cloud (por ejemplo, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) y en entornos con computación distribuida.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación oral y escrita, capaces de explicar conceptos técnicos a audiencias no técnicas y colaborar efectivamente con equipos multidisciplinarios.
Se valora positivamente tener experiencia en el desarrollo e implementación de soluciones con modelos de IA generativa como GPT-4 o similares, incluyendo técnicas como Prompt Engineering y Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Se valora positivamente tener experiencia en el uso de librerías enfocadas a Deep Learning como Tensorflow o PyTorch.
Se valora muy positivamente el interés en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, construyas pipelines en CI, etc.
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar, y una mentalidad hands-on.

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
35% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas 
Te podrás formar a nivel técnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, así como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompañamos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello! 
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.

Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo 

You got it?

We like you!
¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?
Personalization Squad: Equipo al que se incorporará la persona seleccionada y que es responsable de desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes de Mango, tanto en el sitio web y la app como en las comunicaciones por email. Aprovechando el gran volumen de datos de compras y de navegación de los clientes, los algoritmos desarrollados incluyen recomendaciones de productos, segmentaciones de clientes o la generación de contenido personalizado mediante IA generativa, asegurando su despliegue en tiempo real.
 Generative Artificial Intelligence squad: Impulsar iniciativas innovadoras relacionadas con algoritmos generativos (texto, imagen, video, etc). Este squad ha liderado el desarrollo de la plataforma de IA basada en LLM para los casos de uso internos. Además, es responsable de impulsar la transformación que se está llevando a cabo en los procesos creativos empleando modelos de IA de generación de imágenes.
 Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático que determinen las promociones y descuentos óptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.
 Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detección temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cuántas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificación de la temporada.

4164116999.title: Marketing Data Scientist
4164116999.description:
About the job
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.

Primary Responsibilities

Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time-zones

Qualifications

BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years workingwith Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent inter-personal communication skills - especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

4145955350.title: Data Scientist
4145955350.description:
About the job
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.
By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.
Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.
If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

Your Challenge
As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.

Our core values
Outcome over output
Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.
Failure is allowed, learning is a must
We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.
We are all scouts
Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.
We are data-driven
Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.

Tech Stack
We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.
In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.

What You’ll Need to Succeed
You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!

At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.
Data Scientist
Who We Are
At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.
By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.
Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.
If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.
Your Challenge
As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.

You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.
Our core values
Outcome over output
Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.
Failure is allowed, learning is a must
We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.
We are all scouts
Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.
We are data-driven
Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.
Tech Stack
We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.
In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.
What You’ll Need to Succeed
You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Growth & Opportunity
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

4178482425.title: Data Scientist - (F/H)
4178482425.description:
About the job
Started in France in 2016, Mytraffic mission is to empower commerce professionals with the best location analytics and insights to be smarter every day and design the best experiences in physical locations.

We already serve more than 500 customers in many different sectors (Retail, Real Estate, Consulting Companies, Cities…) all over Europe to help them expand their businesses, analyze or predict performances of investments, understand their customers’ habits, benchmark their results with competition… Mytraffic is a hyper growing scale up (+110%/year) supported by 30 Millions € Series B fundraising round with Axa Venture Partners, Alven and Kernel Investissements in November 2022 to finance its European expansion.

In January 2024, Mytraffic announced the strategic acquisition of the Spanish start up Geoblink, becoming Europe's premier location intelligence platform.

📝Job Description

As a Data Scientist at Mytraffic you will be responsible for answering business questions vital to our clients, based on data.

Mytraffic relies on a large amount of spatial datasets to model urban behaviour, which can be used to make decisions such as: where are my competitors? Which is the best location for a new site? Which features are driving my sales? Is my point of sale under/over performing with respect to its potential?

Our dataset streams come from both internal data (coming directly from our customers for their own use) and external data (retrieved, cleaned and prepared internally at Mytraffic from several sources), which are used to deliver analyses and insights allowing our customers to understand their current and past business situation (descriptive analytics), providing them with models and tools to be able to predict the impact and effects of potential business actions and decisions (predictive analytics) and, at a higher level, recommend them which of those actions and decisions should be taken to maximise their final revenue (prescriptive analytics).

To do so we rely heavily on Python, and more precisely, on three different types of technology: data management and analysis tools (e.g. Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn,Plotnine, Jupyter...), machine learning frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, LIME...) and software development oriented libraries (e.g. Flask, Pytest..)

🤝 About Our Team

You will be part of a team called Predictive Analytics, responsible for answering business questions vital to our clients, based on data.

💼 To give you more details about your day-to-day at MyTraffic :

 Design, develop, monitor and maintain a wide range of explanatory and predictive models and integrate them into the production environment so users can make predictions in real time.
 Analyze the most extensive and complete spatial database to understand a wide range of industries (retail, real-state, fmcg, e-mobility) consumer's behaviour patterns, etc.
 Load & Extract data from our datalakes and databases to support clients or build reports.
 Work closely with the rest of the team including Business profiles, the CustomerSuccess team, and other Data Scientists and Software Engineers to understand everyone’s needs and develop optimal solutions.

🫵 About You

We are looking for a Data Scientist (at least 3 years experiences excluding internships) passionate about finding, processing and modelling data to solve real world problems.

You would be one of the main points of reference for clients to, given a business problem, figure out how to solve it with the existing datasets, or how to find out those which could be useful to complement the existing ones.

Here Are Some Other Things We’re Looking For

 BS or MS in degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related field. The candidate should have a solid foundation in the relevant technical concepts and principles.
 You have the ability to approach complex problems with analytical capabilities and critical thinking skills, enjoy facing challenging problems, and are able to apply logical reasoning to find solutions.
 Proficiency in Python programming, including the ability to write functions and classes. You must be comfortable using Python as your primary programming language and be willing to learn and apply additional patterns and best practices.
 Experience in analyzing data using Python and common libraries such asPandas and Scikit-learn.
 You have an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forests, XGBoost, etc., although you are aware that the best solution sometimes is the simplest, and you know when to use one or another solution.
 A good understanding of statistics, including probability theory and common statistical tests.
 Experience with SQL queries, an understanding of different types of joins and the ability to retrieve and manipulate data from relational databases effectively.
 Experience working on projects involving data analysis.
 Familiarity with Linux systems and comfort working through the command line. This means being able to navigate and perform tasks using the command line interface.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analyses to non-technical audiences (stakeholders and clients) in Spanis hand English.
 Ability to find a balance between real-life constraints (e.g.,deadlines, available data) and desired outcomes (e.g., accuracy, over delivery).
 Passionate about what you do. You care deeply about the things you build.

You Will Get Extra Kudos If You Have

 Client-facing experience
 Fluency or understanding of French or German.
 Experience working in a cloud based environment (AWS, GCP...)
 Experience working with distributed databases like Google BigQuery.
 Experience working with spatial data or GIS systems and/or mobility data.
You are familiar with writing Python packages and tested code (e.g. PEP8, Pytest...)

🎁 What We Offer

Joining our scale-up means:

✅ Tailored support – Join an experienced team that will help you grow and develop your skills.

✅ A real impact – Your contributions will play a key role in our clients' strategic decisions.

✅ A culture of innovation – Thrive in an environment that values creativity and ambition to deliver the best to our clients.

✅ Flexibility – Enjoy two days of remote work per week to better balance your professional and personal life.

⚙️ The Recruitment Process

1️⃣ 30 min with our Talent Acquisition

2️⃣ 30 min with your futur manager, Clara

3️⃣ Technical Test with two members of the team

4️⃣ 45 min Values Interview

5️⃣ 30 min with Antoine, Head of Professional Services & Predictive Analytics

We empower the physical world with the capabilities of digital technology.

MyTraffic is a platform that helps organizations make better, more accurate, and more reliable investment decisions for their physical locations.

 Work closely with the rest of the team including Business profiles, the CustomerSuccess team, and other Data Scientists and Software Engineers to understand everyone’s needs and develop optimal solutions.
