4131758391.title: Senior Data Scientist
4131758391.description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else – with class, logical thinking and lots of style 😎 Let’s break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers 🚀 If you’re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don’t worry - that’s not how we do things. They’re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions 🤘

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We’re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It’s a big task, but you won’t do it alone. 💪

You’ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that’ll make our company move forward ⏩

What You’ll Be Doing

Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems

What You'll Need

Experience building and leading a significant data science team within a scaling organisation
Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools.
Deep understanding of fundamentals of probability and statistics.
Big picture thinking - correctly diagnosing problems and productionising research.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads

Nice to have

Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Masters or PhD)
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
Previous experience in anti fraud departments
Experience working at a large tech company worth >$15B
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
 Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

4172144534.title: Statistical Data Scientist Lead
4172144534.description:
About the job
Location: Barcelona - Spain
Hybrid 
Full time 

Our Team

At Sanofi we are chasing the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. We at Global Supply Chain Strategy & Excellence support this ambition by driving strategy and excellence through innovation and digitalization, redesigning work, enabling people, and providing expertise.

At Supply Chain Business Analytics Center of Excellence, we are on a mission to ensure everyone can harness the power of data in every decision. Our ambition is to transform and disrupt the SC practice to make it data-driven and digitally enabled to simplify, accelerate and improve the impact of the decision-making processes steering for best-in-class SC performance.

We believe in empowering the business with execution visibility, advanced analytics and with interactive data visualizations from multiple data sources.

Our scope includes all Supply chain processes: Customer Care, Logistics (Warehousing, Distribution and transportation), Supply chain planning (Distribution requirements planning, Demand planning, Integrated Business Planning, Inventory and Supply Planning) and Production/Scheduling Planning, across all Plants, Regions and Markets and for all Business units (GBUs).

You will contribute to empower the life of our patients worldwide by extracting meaning from data and providing tangible and actionable outcomes using the latest available technics and technologies (AI/ML/GenAI).

Join us in this adventure!

Main Responsibilities

Contribute to our forecasting capabilities through enhancements, automatization and expansion of our forecasting cycle. Defining statistical forecast automation strategies based on advanced cloud computing.
Connect externally to bring outside in expertise in new technologies and techniques, and also benchmark
Provide the best possible forecast signal as it drives decisions on the whole supply chain: what/where/when to buy, produce, ship, stock... so that our medicines are available to our patients in time and at the most efficient cost.
Maintain and improve our current forecast engine code base and develop new features to include more statistical or machine-learning based models and algorithms
Lead innovation projects related to the forecasting cycle and related to increasing the impact of our forecasts within the business
Work with GBU Leads to integrate relevant transversal data for advanced predictive models including but not limited to Sinergy, finance promotions, patients, launch plan and indications, internal and external BOS and Economic Trends.
Partner closely with the Digital Team in M&S in support of Global Supply Chain Strategy and Transformation to ensure the current forecast engine is sustained and robust within Sanofi Platforms
Mentor the team on good coding practices
Ensure a best in class and diverse team by leveraging people’s competencies, reinforcing capabilities, developing all supply chain professionals under their remit.
Strive for standardization, simplification & digitization.
Ensure that data is managed/analyzed in compliance with applicable quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements

About You

Experience: + 8 years’ experience. Have a broad experience with time series forecasting, in particular on the statistical and machine learning models and algorithms. Experience in Data Science related projects. Developing people with new ways of optimizing internal forecasting process and collecting market intelligence. Previous experience improving forecast accuracy by integrating relevant transversal data for advanced predictive models.
Soft skills: Model business problems into data solutions. Ability to understand and interpret forecasting algorithms. Rounded presentation skills; experience in usage of cloud computing technologies and digital platforms within AI framework. Proven leadership in team management and agile project management. High level of emotional intelligence and business integrity; role model for behaviours consistent with our company values. .
Technical skills: program at an advanced level with R and Python. Experience with DevOps/MLOps lifecycle is a plus. SQL, Spark, Docker, AWS experience is a plus.
Education: Degree in Statistics, Computer Engineering, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Economics or related fields. Master in Supply Chain Management, Engineering or similar preferred. PHD is an asset.
Languages: Fluent in English, and fluency in Spanish and other languages is considered an asset. 

Manufacturing & Supply - Leadership Skills

Enterprise Leaders: Are able to have the E2E vision of the business, prioritizing the common interest for the benefit of Sanofi and the patients. Are able to connect the dots for their teams and keep them engaged with the vision.
Transformation Leader: Acts as change management and culture role model to foster employee’s engagement and build a psychologically safe and collaborative workplace.
Decision Maker: Takes timely and data-based decisions in a fast moving and complex environment to drive performance and progress. Promotes an environment where decisions are taken at the right level.
Performance Champion: Embrace digital innovation, AI, GenAI to democratize data and drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, quality, safety, and cost effectiveness.
Business Ally: Understand business landscape Industry & business/client groups knowledge to translate the challenges & bring added value. Stay current with global external trends and integrate insights into strategies achieving sustainable competitive advantage.
People Developer: Unleashes the potential of each one and prepares the leaders of the future. Takes bold decisions to ensure the right talents are at the right place.

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Our scope includes all Supply chain processes: Customer Care, Logistics (Warehousing, Distribution and transportation), Supply chain planning (Distribution requirements planning, Demand planning, Integrated Business Planning
, Inventory
and
Supply
Planning) and Production/Scheduling Planning, across all Plants, Regions and
M
arkets and for all Business units (GBUs).
You will contribute to empower the life of our patients worldwide by extracting meaning from data and providing tangible and actionable outcomes using the latest available technics and
technologies (AI/ML/GenAI).
Join us in this adventure!
Main Responsibilities
Contribute to our forecasting capabilities through enhancements, automatization and expansion of our forecasting cycle. Defining statistical forecast automation strategies based on advanced cloud computing.
Connect externally to bring outside in expertise in new technologies and techniques, and also benchmark
Provide the best possible forecast signal as it drives decisions on the whole supply chain: what/where/when to buy, produce, ship, stock... so that our medicines are available to our patients in time and at the most efficient cost.
Maintain and improve our current forecast engine code base and develop new features to include more statistical or machine-learning based models and algorithms
Lead innovation projects related to the forecasting cycle and related to increasing the impact of our forecasts within the business
Work with GBU Leads to integrate relevant transversal data for advanced predictive models including but not limited to Sinergy, finance promotions, patients, launch plan and indications, internal and external BOS and Economic Trends.
Partner closely with the Digital Team in M&S in support of Global Supply Chain Strategy and Transformation to ensure the current forecast engine is sustained and robust within Sanofi Platforms
Mentor the team on good coding practices
Ensure a best in class and diverse team by leveraging people’s competencies, reinforcing capabilities, developing all supply chain professionals under their remit.
Strive for standardization, simplification & digitization.
Ensure that data is managed/analyzed in compliance with applicable quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements

About You
Experience: + 8 years’ experience. Have a broad experience with time series forecasting, in particular on the statistical and machine learning models and algorithms. Experience in Data Science related projects. Developing people with new ways of optimizing internal forecasting process and collecting market intelligence. Previous experience improving forecast accuracy by integrating relevant transversal data for advanced predictive models.
Soft skills: Model business problems into data solutions. Ability to understand and interpret forecasting algorithms. Rounded presentation skills; experience in usage of cloud computing technologies and digital platforms within AI framework. Proven leadership in team management and agile project management. High level of emotional intelligence and business integrity; role model for behaviours consistent with our company values. .
Technical skills: program at an advanced level with R and Python. Experience with DevOps/MLOps lifecycle is a plus. SQL, Spark, Docker, AWS experience is a plus.
Education: Degree in Statistics, Computer Engineering, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Economics or related fields. Master in Supply Chain Management, Engineering or similar preferred. PHD is an asset.
Languages: Fluent in English, and fluency in Spanish and other languages is considered an asset.

4165709578.title: Principal Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence) - €87k + 10% bonus
4165709578.description:
About the job
Are you a Senior or Lead Data Scientist (with AI experience) who's ready to move into a Principal role? We have 3 new openings paying €87k + 10% bonus

Industry: AI software for Pharma, start-up - heavily backed by a global investor
Workplace: Hybrid - 2 days per week
Offices: Barcelona or Madrid

Our client, the AI tech firm, are helping change the world of Pharma. 2025 is going to be a very busy year and we need 3 Lead Data Scientists who are ready for their next move in either Madrid or Barcelona. You don't need to have managed / led teams, but you will need to have experience mentoring & coaching.

Question tiiiiiime.....
Do you know how the data you're working with effects the business? This question is KEY.
Do you have a passion/interest for Tech / AI and see how it can help improve Healthcare?
Are you a people-person and someone who can work in an start-up, nimble environment?

Tech stack / experience needed:
Python, R, SQL
Lead an AI lab and develop AI products
OO programming - APUI's, AWS Lambda, crontab
4+ years Machine Learning methodologies
Business acumen, experience with stakeholders
Experience with embeddings, genAI and some LLM fine tuning
Calibration of unbalanced problems, RF vs XGB, data leakage with oversampling
PhD or Masters in Data Science / Engineering / Mathematics 
AWS experience is a bonus

The AI platform is literally flying off the shelf and the leading Pharma's in the market are knocking on their door as nobody else can do what they can. Come and join this rocket-ship, be part of something that is genuinely improving the world around us, using Artificial Intelligence.

Message me on here and we can discuss the company and position in more detail - matt@hawksworthuk.com

I look forward to hearing from you.

#artificialintelligence #datascience #pharma #munich #madrid #barcelona #gamechanging

4145909001.title: DATA SCIENTIST
4145909001.description:
About the job
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA SCIENTIST

¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango está formado por Data Scientist, Ingenieros de Big Data e Ingenieros de Software que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la última tecnología en plataformas de Big Data y computación distribuida.

Cada Una De Las Brigadas De Análisis Avanzado Tiene Como Objetivo Desarrollar y Evolucionar Algoritmos De Aprendizaje Automático Para Hacer Frente a Algunos De Los Principales Retos Técnicos y Empresariales De Mango

 Personalitazion Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes del sitio web y de la App de Mango, incluyendo recomendaciones de producto, ajuste y tamaño, aprovechando las capacidades de despliegue en tiempo real y el flujo de clics en tiempo real.
 Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático que determinen las promociones y descuentos óptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.
 Forecasting Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de previsión de series temporales para predecir la evolución de las ventas y los rendimientos tanto a corto como a largo plazo.
 Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detección temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cuántas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificación de la temporada.

Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.

¿CÓMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?

En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy dinámico, motivado por las nuevas tecnologías, con pasión por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a través de los datos.

¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?

Como Data Scientist formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. Trabajarás desarrollando soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial desarrolladas con modelos de datos y algoritmos de última generación. Estos productos de datos permiten casos de uso muy innovadores en el espacio del retail, como la geoanalítica, la robotización, la personalización omnicanal, la tienda conectada, la visión por ordenador, el consumidor 360º y las decisiones en tiempo real.

En tu día a día…

Realizarás el desarrollo de algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales.
Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería (por ejemplo, integración continua, automatización de pruebas, etc.) en un sólido equipo de ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos.
Utilizarás Spark para escalar tus modelos y aprovecha las herramientas de MLOps para desplegarlos en producción.
Interactuarás con las partes interesadas del negocio para asegurar la alineación y la adopción adecuadas; y participar en la entrega del proyecto de principio a fin.
Trabajarás con un enfoque rápido e iterativo en nuevas ideas y pruebas de conceptos.
Estarás conectado a los últimos desarrollos en Big Data y MLOps e invertirás tiempo en traer nuevas tecnologías y mejores prácticas a Mango.

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Grado en Ciencias de Datos, Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística u otros campos cuantitativos
Experiencia desarrollando modelos matemáticos y algoritmos predictivos (modelos supervisados y no supervisados, clustering, redes neuronales...)
Experiencia desarrollando soluciones de machine learning a nivel de producción en un entorno cloud con computación distribuida.
Se valorará la experiencia en aprendizaje profundo
Experiencia trabajando en un entorno de nube (por ejemplo, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
Capacidad para poseer la entrega de un proyecto, incluyendo la comunicación con las partes interesadas del negocio y para realizar presentaciones a nivel de la junta directiva
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en programación, la experiencia en Python es un plus
Experiencia en la implementación de ETL, utilizando la plataforma BigData es un plus

 ¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
35% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas 
Te podrás formar a nivel técnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, así como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompañamos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello! 
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso , trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo.

You got it?

We like you!

4168755710.title: Data Scientist (NLP Deep Learning Engineer)
4168755710.description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Deep Learning Engineers at Revolut are at the forefront of GenAI and LLM integration, building transformative products that range from user-facing tools to advanced process optimisation and data understanding solutions. You’ll work with the most advanced LLMs available out there, developing solutions that have a tangible impact on millions of Revolut customers worldwide.

As a Deep Learning Engineer, you’ll be embedded in dynamic, cross-functional teams with Product Owners, Software Engineers, Data Analysts, and Operations Managers. Together, you’ll solve complex problems and deliver automated, scalable solutions that continually improve. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate with top-tier professionals in Product, Design, Engineering, and AI to shape the future of Revolut’s AI-driven capabilities.

Our projects span the creation of personal assistants, intelligent chatbots, copilots, and more, all designed to elevate user experience and revolutionise customer interaction. We experiment, iterate, and build intelligent systems that improve over time through advanced algorithms and deep learning techniques.

What You’ll Be Doing

Building AI-driven features from scratch like personal assistants, chatbots, copilots and more.
Developing user-focused and backend features using deep learning
Delivering impactful, scalable, data-driven AI solutions
Collaborating with Product, Engineering, and Data teams to solve deep learning challenges
Integrating cutting-edge AI technologies to drive innovation at Revolut

What You'll Need

Experience in Deep Learning within Natural Language Processing area and Large Language Models
A Bachelor's degree in a STEM major (mathematics, computer science, engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science (python, SQL) and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
Big picture thinking to correctly diagnose problems and productionising research
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads

Nice to have

A master's or PhD in a quantitative discipline
Strong experience with additional programming languages, such as Java, Scala, C++
Experience at a large tech company worth >$15B
School/University Olympic medal competitions in physics, maths, economics or programming

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
 Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

4174801927.title: Senior Data Scientist
4174801927.description:
About the job
Our client works on very challenging and exciting projects and is looking for Senior Data Scientists

Responsibilities:
Development and training of transformer-based models for both text and images.
Architect and oversee the entire model lifecycle, from data preparation, model design, training, development and validation to model deployment and monitoring.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts, to design and implement AI-driven solutions.
Stay current with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, integrating new techniques and technologies as appropriate.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong expertise with large scale Neural Networks, Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning techniques.
Practical exposure to GenAI projects and related frameworks (RAG apps, vector DBs, LangChain, LlamaIndex, agentic frameworks, ...)
Advanced knowledge of Python and machine learning frameworks (SciPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, pyMC, pgmpy, ...)
Hands-on experience with one or more cloud computing platforms (Azure - preferred, AWS, GCP).
Understanding of the whole ML lifecycle and experience with MLOps/DataOps.
Experience with Probabilistic Graphical Modelling (Bayesian Networks, Markov Random Fields, Factor Graphs, ...)
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Good communication skills, fluent English.

Start date: ASAP
Contract Duration: 6 months with likelihood of extension
Remote vs Onsite: Fully remote, with possible occasional in person team sessions / workshops / gatherings (i.e. 1x quarter) likely to take place in Prague
US Hours overlap needed?: Minimum 2-6pm CET, preferred 2-7pm CET

4094016456.title: Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer
4094016456.description:
About the job
Eurecat es el principal centro tecnológico de Cataluña y la segunda organización de investigación privada más grande del sur de Europa. Aglutina la experiencia de más de 800 profesionales y presta servicio a cerca de 2.000 empresas. I+D aplicado, servicios tecnológicos, formación de alta especialización, consultoría tecnológica o valorización y explotación de la propiedad industrial son algunos de los servicios que Eurecat ofrece tanto para grandes como para pequeñas y medianas empresas de todos los sectores. El centro tecnológico participa en más de 200 grandes proyectos consorciados de I+D+i nacionales e internacionales de alto valor estratégico y cuenta con 181 patentes y 10 spin-off. El valor añadido que aporta Eurecat acelera la innovación, disminuye el gasto en infraestructuras científicas y tecnológicas, reduce los riesgos y proporciona conocimiento especializado a medida de cada empresa.

Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Big Data Analytics

INVESTIGADOR/A - Data Scientist & Machine Learning

Estamos buscando un Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer con motivación y experiencia en el ámbito del Machine Learning aplicado, para unirse a nuestro equipo. Participarás en proyectos de desarrollo e innovación con un alto impacto tecnológico, utilizando algoritmos que pueden incluir predicción de series temporales, procesos estocásticos, machine learning clásico, natural language processing, deep learning y sistemas de recomendación, entre otros. Trabajarás con organizaciones de diversos sectores como cultural, legal, digital media, impacto social y digitalización. Además tendrás la posibilidad de desarrollar ideas de investigación aplicada y participar en la redacción de artículos científicos que serán presentados en conferencias internacionales.

Estamos interesados en distintos tipos de perfiles. Principalmente:

Un perfil con conocimiento de procesos estocásticos, centrado en forecasting, análisis y predicción de series temporales.
Un perfil enfocado en NLP (comprensión y generación), aplicaciones de LLM y ámbitos relacionados.


FUNCIONES

Diseñar y desarrollar soluciones que respondan a los retos de los clientes o socios de los proyectos, aplicando técnicas de análisis de series temporales, forecasting y procesos estocásticos.
Aplicar técnicas como el natural language processing (NLP), el machine learning clásico, el deep learning y la optimización matemática, según la experiencia del candidato y las necesidades de cada proyecto.
Investigar técnicas y métodos innovadores en el ámbito de la inteligencia artificial que conformen el estado del arte, a fin de mantenerse actualizado con las nuevas tendencias.
Participar en la preparación de propuestas de proyectos de investigación y desarrollo (p.ej. convocatorias CDTI Cervera, MICIU PCPPs, etc.), desde la toma de requerimientos con el cliente hasta el planteamiento de la solución técnica y la redacción del plan de trabajo.
Redactar documentación técnica básica, relacionada con las soluciones implementadas en los proyectos.
Participar en la redacción de artículos y presentaciones para compartir los resultados de la investigación y el desarrollo con la comunidad académica y la industria.


OFRECEMOS

Formación en ámbitos relacionados con el machine learning y la inteligencia artificial
Formación de idiomas (catalán, castellano, inglés)
Horario flexible y esquema híbrido de teletrabajo
Jornada laboral intensiva los viernes y horario de verano
Añádete a un equipo dinámico y multidisciplinar


Esta posición está ubicada en la sede de Barcelona de Eurecat

Requisitos:

Experiencia en el ámbito del machine learning aplicado, con especial foco en el forecasting y en el análisis de series temporales o en el ámbito del procesamiento del lenguaje natural.
Conocimiento y experiencia en análisis de datos, limpieza, preparación, pre-procesamiento y visualización.
Conocimiento en técnicas de NLP: generación de word-embeddings, búsquedas semánticas, Large Language Models, etc.
Altas capacidades de conceptualizar, diseñar y plantear soluciones.
Buenas capacidades de exposición y documentación de las tareas realizadas.
Experiencia en el lenguaje de programación Python y en sus librerías más importantes en los ámbitos del machine learning (scikit-learn), deep learning (PyTorch o tensorflow), natural language processing (transformers, spaCy).
Experiencia en el uso de sistemas de control de versiones, en particular, Git.
Interés y experiencia en I+D


Se valorará:

Haber participado en la publicación de artículos científicos y asistido a conferencias internacionales.
Haber participado en proyectos financiados por la Comisión Europea (Horizon Europe, H2020 y anteriores)
Conocimiento y experiencia en sistemas recomendadores.
Experiencia en el uso de Docker y de sistemas Linux.
Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Big Data Analytics

3969208778.title: Lead DS (Data Scientist) Bangkok based, Relocation provided
3969208778.description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

 Our Purpose –  Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity

We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.

As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world’s largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.

In This Role, You’ll Get to

Design, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness
Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation
Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality
Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a difference

What You’ll Need To Succeed

4+ years hands-on data science experience
Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks
Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala
Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team
Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment

It’s Great if You Have

PhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields
Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems
Hands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop
Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTA

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

4138061715.title: Data Scientist Senior / Experto IA
4138061715.description:
About the job
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil experto en Ciencia del Dato / IA / ML / GenIA dentro de nuestra unidad de negocio de Data & Analytics, ubicada en las oficinas de Madrid o Barcelona.

El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.

Funciones y responsabilidades:
Comprender las necesidades y requisitos de los clientes y elaborar íntegramente propuestas asociadas a proyectos analítica avanzada: disponiblización de una plataforma de ML/AI, implementación de modelos de ML/AI, integración de ML/AI/GenAI en los procesos de negocio de una compañía, frameworks de trabajo asociados.
Responsabilizarse del enfoque de la solución que mejor puede dar respuesta a las problemáticas identificadas y mayores beneficios puede proporcionar, en oportunidades relativas a Machine Learning (ML), Inteligencia Artificial (AI) así como Inteligencia Artificial Generativa (GenAI).
Acompañar en el diseño de propuestas de migración/modernización desde entornos on-premise a entornos Cloud, de modelos de ML que pueda tener el cliente.
Defensa ante los clientes de propuestas y planteamientos estratégicos.
Planteamiento de artefactos y componentes estructurales así como estandarización del uso de las arquitecturas de datos por parte de los equipos de delivery, consumidores de dichas arquitecturas (Devops, CI/CD, Estándares, Frameworks de trabajo)
Acompañar en la evolución el Demo Center para contemplar prototipos y demos sobre modelos y servicios de ML/AI/GenAI
Acompañar a los proyectos en las fases iniciales para garantizar y certificar diseños de arquitectura, y ayudar en la resolución de riesgos o problemas.

BENEFICIOS
> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.
> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.
> Modalidad de trabajo remoto, con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a nuestras oficinas/clientes ubicados en Madrid o Barcelona.
> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.
> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).
> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.
> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).
> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil experto en Ciencia del Dato / IA / ML / GenIA dentro de nuestra unidad de negocio de Data & Analytics, ubicada en las oficinas de Madrid o Barcelona.
Logicalis Spain

4164116998.title: Marketing Data Scientist
4164116998.description:
About the job
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.

Primary Responsibilities

Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time-zones

Qualifications

BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years workingwith Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent inter-personal communication skills - especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

4117187309.title: Data Scientist for Supply Chain (Junior/Senior profiles)
4117187309.description:
About the job
About Accenture Data & AI For Supply Chain Team

We are a global Center of Excellence specializing in Data & AI for Supply Chain, with a rapidly growing team of 180+ professionals. Our mission is to turn data into a strategic advantage, driving operational excellence, agility, and smarter, faster decision-making across the end-to-end supply chain.

As we continue to expand, we are looking for passionate professionals to join our team and shape the future of intelligent supply chains.

Our Focus Areas


 Supply Chain Planning – AI-driven demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and planning solutions to enhance agility and efficiency.

 Fulfillment & Network Optimization – Advanced analytics to optimize logistics, warehouse management, distribution, network and last-mile delivery, improving speed, cost, and service levels.

 Manufacturing – AI, machine learning, and IoT to drive predictive maintenance, production efficiency, and quality control in smart manufacturing.


Your role

As a Data Scientist in Accenture’s Data & AI for Supply Chain team, you will:


Apply AI, advanced analytics, and optimization techniques to solve complex supply chain challenges.

Engage directly with clients, translating business needs into AI-driven solutions and delivering measurable impact.

Drive business development, contributing to proposals, identifying new opportunities, and shaping innovative AI offerings.

Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business consultants, to implement cutting-edge supply chain solutions


What Skills Are We Looking For?

Basic Qualifications:

✔ Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. ✔ Proficiency in English (additional languages are a plus). ✔ 2+ years of experience in Data & AI or related fields (we are hiring at different experience levels).

We seek professionals with strong expertise in AI, analytics, and optimization applied to supply chain challenges. While you don’t need to master all of them, experience in multiple areas will be highly valuable. Key skills include:


Programming: Python, R, SQL

Operation Reasearch & Simulation: LP, ILP, Heuristics/Meta-Heuristics, Discrete Events Simulation, digital twins.

Machine Learning & AI: Forecasting, predictive modeling, optimization algorithms.

Generative AI: LLMs, AI-driven scenario generation, synthetic data modeling, and workflow automation.

Cloud & Big Data: Experience with Azure, AWS, or GCP, including AI/ML services.

Supply Chain Solutions: Familiarity with o9, Blue Yonder (BY), SAP IBP, or similar tools.

Data Engineering & Visualization: Large-scale data processing, market solutions/platforms (Databricks, Snowflake, ..), and tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.


Soft & Strategic Skills

Beyond technical expertise, we look for professionals who can think strategically, collaborate effectively, and drive impact in complex environments. Key skills include:


Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking: Ability to analyze supply chain challenges and design AI-driven solutions.

Business Acumen: Understanding the impact of AI and analytics on supply chain efficiency, resilience, and cost reduction.

Communication & Stakeholder Management: Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations for technical and non-technical audiences.

Agility & Innovation: Comfortable working in fast-paced, evolving environments, with a passion for continuous learning and innovation.


What’s in It for You?

Join Accenture’s Data & AI for Supply Chain team and unlock a challenging and rewarding career, where you will:


Work on high-impact AI & analytics projects with global clients.

Collaborate with a team of 180+ data scientists and engineers, including 20% PhDs in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or Statistics.

Drive cutting-edge AI innovation, including Generative AI applications in supply chain.

Enjoy a flexible, hybrid work model in a Great Place to Work®-recognized company.


Additional Benefits:


Comprehensive insurance (medical, life, and accident).

Wellness programs and medical services.

Flexible compensation programs & stock purchase plans.

Sustainability initiatives & Accenture Foundation programs.

Diversity & inclusion networks in a globally recognized company.

Flexibility programs (customized schedules, extra vacation days, etc.).


If you are excited about leading AI-driven transformations in supply chain, we’d love to hear from you!
About Accenture Data & AI For Supply Chain Team
Supply Chain Planning – AI-driven demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and planning solutions to enhance agility and efficiency.
Fulfillment & Network Optimization – Advanced analytics to optimize logistics, warehouse management, distribution, network and last-mile delivery, improving speed, cost, and service levels.
Manufacturing – AI, machine learning, and IoT to drive predictive maintenance, production efficiency, and quality control in smart manufacturing.
Apply AI, advanced analytics, and optimization techniques to solve complex supply chain challenges.
Engage directly with clients, translating business needs into AI-driven solutions and delivering measurable impact.
Drive business development, contributing to proposals, identifying new opportunities, and shaping innovative AI offerings.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business consultants, to implement cutting-edge supply chain solutions
Programming: Python, R, SQL
Operation Reasearch & Simulation: LP, ILP, Heuristics/Meta-Heuristics, Discrete Events Simulation, digital twins.
Machine Learning & AI: Forecasting, predictive modeling, optimization algorithms.
Generative AI: LLMs, AI-driven scenario generation, synthetic data modeling, and workflow automation.
Cloud & Big Data: Experience with Azure, AWS, or GCP, including AI/ML services.
Supply Chain Solutions: Familiarity with o9, Blue Yonder (BY), SAP IBP, or similar tools.
Data Engineering & Visualization: Large-scale data processing, market solutions/platforms (Databricks, Snowflake, ..), and tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking: Ability to analyze supply chain challenges and design AI-driven solutions.
Business Acumen: Understanding the impact of AI and analytics on supply chain efficiency, resilience, and cost reduction.
Communication & Stakeholder Management: Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations for technical and non-technical audiences.
Agility & Innovation: Comfortable working in fast-paced, evolving environments, with a passion for continuous learning and innovation.

4137739449.title: DATA SCIENTIST
4137739449.description:
About the job
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA SCIENTIST

¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

En MANGO, estamos comprometidos en convertirnos en una empresa impulsada por datos y estamos formando un equipo de Data y Advanced Analytics compuesto por más de 50 profesionales. Este equipo incluye perfiles como ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers y Software Engineers, con el objetivo de desarrollar plataformas de vanguardia. Estas plataformas permitirán a nuestros squads analíticos crear soluciones innovadoras basadas en Inteligencia Artificial.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics está compuesto por el squad de IA generativa centrado en iniciativas con algoritmos generativos y en el desarrollo de una plataforma interna basada en LLM. El squad de personalización, que crea algoritmos para ofrecer experiencias personalizadas y recomendaciones de productos en tiempo real en mango.com; el squad de Pricing, que optimiza promociones y descuentos para mejorar el margen de la compañía. Y finalmente, el squad de Producto se focaliza en mejorar las decisiones en los primeros pasos de la creación de la colección.

Para este último squad, estamos buscando un/a Senior Data Scientist, preferiblemente con experiencia en el sector retail-fashion para trabajar en proyectos como la optimización de las cantidades de compra para nuevas colecciones, previsión de ventas a corto y largo plazo, y desarrollo de sistemas de recomendación de tallas, fits y estilos. Además de proyectos ya en producción como la anticipación de best-sellers o etiquetado automático de características de prenda mediante técnicas de computer visión y procesamiento de lenguaje natural.

Todos los proyectos se desarrollan en la nube de AWS utilizando una variedad de herramientas y servicios avanzados. Entre ellos se incluyen Amazon S3 para almacenamiento, AWS Lambda para computación sin servidor, y diversas APIs para la integración de servicios. Además, empleamos Apache Airflow para la orquestación y programación de flujos de trabajo, y Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) para la gestión de contenedores y Jenkins para su despliegue. Utilizamos MongoDB como nuestra base de datos NoSQL y Databricks para nuestro Datalake.

¿QUÉ HACE UN/A DATA SCIENTIST SENIOR EN MANGO? 

Como Senior Data Scientist especializado/a en retail-fashion formarás parte del equipo que trabaja en la investigación, definición, prototipado, desarrollo y puesta en producción de soluciones basadas en algorítmica de IA.

En tu día a día…

Entenderás los problemas/dificultades que se encuentran los diferentes departamentos de planificación, compras, distribución, etc.
Desarrollarás pruebas de concepto rápidas con herramientas como Streamlit, entendiendo la calidad y el potencial de los datos disponibles y/o necesarios, extrayendo conocimiento relevante que permita preparar un posible proyecto futuro con métricas de ROI asociadas.
Redactarás statements of work básicos de proyectos con todas las partes implicadas.
Desarrollarás proyectos basados en algoritmos de Machine Learning en entornos de producción.
Colaborarás con otros Data Scientists, ML Engineers y miembros del equipo de Advanced Analytics para la correcta implementación de soluciones.
Utilizarás tecnologías Big Data para manejar grandes volúmenes de datos y mejorar la eficiencia de los modelos.

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Grado/Máster en Ing. Informática, Ing. Ciencia de Datos, o similar.
Al menos 5 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Experiencia en el uso y puesta en producción de librerías enfocadas a Deep Learning como TensorFlow o PyTorch.
Sólidos conocimientos en Machine Learning y redes neuronales. Arquitecturas y métodos de evaluación.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones software basadas en Machine Learning y capacidad para definir la experimentación necesaria en este tipo de proyectos. Se valora positivamente haber liderado el desarrollo end-to-end de un proyecto desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento.
Se valora muy positivamente el conocimiento en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, pipelines en CI (Jenkins), etc.
Se valora haber trabajado con servicios cloud mencionados anteriormente.
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar y una mentalidad hands-on.

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
35% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas 
Te podrás formar a nivel técnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, así como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompañamos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello! 
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo 

You got it?

We like you!
¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?
Advanced Analytics
squad
Senior
Data Scientist
retail-fashion
fits
best-sellers
¿QUÉ HACE UN/A DATA SCIENTIST SENIOR EN MANGO?

Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar y una mentalidad hands-on.
¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?
Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
35% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas

Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello! 
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo

4168755711.title: Data Scientist (NLP Deep Learning Engineer)
4168755711.description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Deep Learning Engineers at Revolut are at the forefront of GenAI and LLM integration, building transformative products that range from user-facing tools to advanced process optimisation and data understanding solutions. You’ll work with the most advanced LLMs available out there, developing solutions that have a tangible impact on millions of Revolut customers worldwide.

As a Deep Learning Engineer, you’ll be embedded in dynamic, cross-functional teams with Product Owners, Software Engineers, Data Analysts, and Operations Managers. Together, you’ll solve complex problems and deliver automated, scalable solutions that continually improve. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate with top-tier professionals in Product, Design, Engineering, and AI to shape the future of Revolut’s AI-driven capabilities.

Our projects span the creation of personal assistants, intelligent chatbots, copilots, and more, all designed to elevate user experience and revolutionise customer interaction. We experiment, iterate, and build intelligent systems that improve over time through advanced algorithms and deep learning techniques.

What You’ll Be Doing

Building AI-driven features from scratch like personal assistants, chatbots, copilots and more.
Developing user-focused and backend features using deep learning
Delivering impactful, scalable, data-driven AI solutions
Collaborating with Product, Engineering, and Data teams to solve deep learning challenges
Integrating cutting-edge AI technologies to drive innovation at Revolut

What You'll Need

Experience in Deep Learning within Natural Language Processing area and Large Language Models
A Bachelor's degree in a STEM major (mathematics, computer science, engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science (python, SQL) and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
Big picture thinking to correctly diagnose problems and productionising research
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads

Nice to have

A master's or PhD in a quantitative discipline
Strong experience with additional programming languages, such as Java, Scala, C++
Experience at a large tech company worth >$15B
School/University Olympic medal competitions in physics, maths, economics or programming

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
 Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

4173168093.title: Staff Data Scientist - Bioprocessing
4173168093.description:
About the job
The Company

At Invert, we are on a mission to dramatically reduce the dollar and time cost of using biology to manufacture ~everything. Our customers use bioprocessing to do things like: produce new therapies to combat disease, create new biomaterials to solve the environmental crisis, and manufacture essential chemicals cleanly. We provide them with tools to automate the design, execution, and analysis of all that amazing work!

The Invert team is comprised of creative and talented engineers, data scientists, biologists, and more, and we are supported by amazing investors. We value diversity and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join our remote-first, collaborative environment.

The team

You will be joining our Data Science team, working on groundbreaking applied research solutions that not only set new industry standards but also redefine the boundaries of possibility for our customers. Your work will be at the forefront of innovation, pushing the limits of what's achievable in bioprocessing and shaping the future of our field.

The role

Mission

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will lead the development of models and algorithms. You will be responsible for selecting and applying the right models, preparing datasets, and identifying opportunities to build large foundational models specific to bioprocess data. In this role, you will contribute through hands-on work, push the scientific bar with reproducible and well-documented research, and ship models that will multiply speed and product for our customers.

Competencies

Analytical: Exceptional problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of data science methodologies
Ambitious: Intrinsically motivated, driven to succeed
Track record: Has shown leadership and vision in the bioprocess industry with published research
Communicates effectively: Ensures that the right information gets to the right people at the right time
Innovates: Constantly brings new ideas and approaches to improve bioprocess outcomes
Takes ownership: Takes accountability, prioritizes team success
Technically skilled: Proficient in time series forecasting, optimization, neural networks, feature engineering, statistical techniques, linear algebra, hybrid modelling, fluid dynamics, adaptive experimentation, bayesian methods
Technically productive: Delivers high-quality results with a focus on velocity
Trustworthy: Acts in the company’s best interests

The package

High-growth startup with impactful work
Fully remote, distributed across US and European timezones
Competitive salary, equity, and benefits
New laptop, monitor, and accessories of your choice
Frequent team off sites
Unlimited PTO

The interview process

The interview process consists of the four stages described below. Candidates are assessed between each of these stages. The hiring manager is responsible for communicating decisions and next steps throughout the process. We aim to complete all stages within two weeks.

Discovery: A 30-minute conversation with the hiring manager to determine whether there is mutual interest in moving forward. 
Bioprocess and Data Science Competencies: A 60-minute deep dive technical conversation with a team data scientist to assess bioprocess and data science theory competencies. 
Technical Competencies: A 90-minute working session with two employees to assess python coding competencies. 
Non-Technical Competencies: Two 60-minute interviews with two different employees to assess non-technical competencies. 
References and Founder Chat: Three 15-minute conversations between the hiring manager and previous colleagues to gather external input. Simultaneously, a 30-minute meet-and-greet with one or both of the founders (depending on whether they have already participated in previous interviews).

4164124067.title: Marketing Data Scientist
4164124067.location: Las Rozas de Madrid, Community of Madrid, Spain
4164124067.description:
About the job
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.

Primary Responsibilities

Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time-zones

Qualifications

BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years workingwith Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent inter-personal communication skills - especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment
